snippet.title: Facebook (Windows Phone 8)
snippet.description: The slick and easy-to-use design makes Facebook for Windows Phone 8 a worthy free download, but the lack of key features will disappoint power users.

snippet.title: Facebook for Android
snippet.description: The official Facebook app is, without question, the best way to access the social network from your Android device.

snippet.title: Facebook Home
snippet.description: Because Facebook Home dominates your Android start screen, it really only makes sense if you're a Facebook junkie. Luckily, you can dial down Facebook Home or completely remove it, even if it comes preloaded on your device.

snippet.title: Facebook Paper
snippet.description: Facebook's Paper is a new and attractive way to browse the social network and get the latest news, but its unclear why it's better to have two Facebook apps rather than one.

snippet.title: Facebook Messenger for Android
snippet.description: Facebook Messenger is still the best way to chat with Facebook friends from your Android device.

snippet.title: Facebook Messenger for Windows Phone
snippet.description: Download Facebook Messenger if you want the same robust chatting features from Facebook's Web site on your phone.

snippet.title: Facebook prepares trio of new privacy tweaks
snippet.description: Social network readies small interface changes to make it easier to customize per-post privacy settings, while acknowledging past privacy errors.

snippet.title: Facebook for iOS
snippet.description: The latest version of the app is the best yet, making it a must-download for Facebook users. The new communication tools will make it easier to connect with friends and get the latest status updates.

snippet.title: Change your Facebook privacy settings with a click
snippet.description: The free MyFacePrivacy app gives you four one-click options for setting the Facebook privacy level you're comfortable with. It also provides a straightforward interface for customizing your Facebook privacy options.

snippet.title: FTC OKs Facebook+WhatsApp, warns against privacy violations
snippet.description: Facebook may have cleared a hurdle in its purchase of WhatsApp, but the FTC will be watching closely to keep the social networks honest.
